summary: Email chain between a federal prosecutor and a FedEx paralegal regarding obtaining a records custodian to authenticate FedEx records for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The records relate to a 2008 subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida concerning Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Tracy Chapell
persons.role: Senior Paralegal at Federal Express Corporation Legal Department
persons.context: FedEx employee corresponding with federal prosecutors about providing a records custodian to authenticate FedEx records for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the upcoming trial in New York in November 2021, for which the FedEx records are being sought.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced indirectly in an email asking if the records pertain to 'the' Jeffrey Epstein, indicating the records are related to his case.

persons.name: Tracy Ferrara
persons.context: Identified as the FedEx point of contact for a subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in February 2008.

persons.name: Erin
persons.role: Unknown (likely law enforcement or legal staff)
persons.context: Email sender who connects the prosecutor with Tracy Chapell, noting Chapell has been helpful in the past.

connections.description: Chapell is assisting in obtaining FedEx records for use as evidence in Maxwell's trial.
Maxwell's trial is connected to the broader Jeffrey Epstein investigation, as indicated by the reference to him.
Erin states Chapell has been extremely helpful in the past and is connecting her with a prosecutor.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Scheduled
events.description: The trial of Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to start in New York in November 2021.

events.title: Subpoena to FedEx from SD Florida
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida sent a subpoena to FedEx in February 2008.

keyFacts: Prosecutors are seeking a FedEx records custodian to authenticate records for the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
The FedEx records are connected to a subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in February 2008, during the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
The email chain confirms the ongoing preparation for Maxwell's trial as of July 2021.
A FedEx employee, Tracy Ferrara, was the point of contact for the 2008 subpoena.
The correspondence shows coordination between law enforcement and corporate legal departments to secure trial evidence.
